name: KFoundation
tagline: Cross-Platform General-Purposed Foundation for Modern C++ Programming
body:
# The KFoundation Story

KFoundation is a made by Kay, a programmer who used to program in C++ a long time ago, but lived most of his life in the harmonious world of Java, and the well-organized Foundation framework of Objective-C. He finds himself again in the world of C++ that even with new revisions as C++11 etc. looks old and backwards, and unnecessarily complicated. He wanted something small, elegant, yet highly capable, fast and modern. And so, the KFoundation was born.

KFoundation is portable and cross-platform, and it is downward compatible down to C++98.

# Want to Know More?

* Take a look at the [README.TXT file](https://github.com/hkhandan/kfoundation/blob/master/README.TXT)

* See the [documentation page](http://hkhandan.github.io/kfoundation/docs/index.html) for a full list of features or to brows API documentation. 

* Or, download the entire documentation in [one PDF file](http://hkhandan.github.io/kfoundation/refman.pdf)


# Want to Get It?

The best way to get KFoundation is by cloning its git repository to your local machine.

```
$git clone https:://github.com/hkhandan/kfoundation.git
```

Alternatively, you can download the latest release from https://github.com/hkhandan/kfoundation/releases page.

To install you need
* CMake 3.0 or above
* A Compatible C++98 or above compiler (gcc or clang would do)

```
$cd kfoundation
$mkdir build
$cd build
$cmake ..
$make
$sudo make install
```
